intro: Cheirostylis malipoensis, commonly known as the Malipo orchid, is a rare and endemic orchid species native to China. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in mountainous regions with rich soil. Its leaves are usually elongated and lance-shaped, while its inflorescence bears small, clustered blooms. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
